dt: {bc}to deprive of the use of a limb and especially a leg
{bc}to deprive of capability for service or of strength, efficiency, or wholeness

pt: {sc}maim{/sc} {sc}cripple{/sc} {sc}mutilate{/sc} {sc}batter{/sc} {sc}mangle{/sc} mean to injure so severely as to cause lasting damage. {sc}maim{/sc} implies the loss or injury of a bodily member through violence.
{sc}cripple{/sc} implies the loss or serious impairment of an arm or leg.
{sc}mutilate{/sc} implies the cutting off or removal of an essential part of a person or thing thereby impairing its completeness, beauty, or function.
{sc}batter{/sc} implies a series of blows that bruise deeply, deform, or mutilate.

pt.t: an old ship {it}battered{/it} by fierce storms

pt: {sc}mangle{/sc} implies a tearing or crushing that leaves deep wounds.

{sc}weaken{/sc} {sc}enfeeble{/sc} {sc}debilitate{/sc} {sc}undermine{/sc} {sc}sap{/sc} {sc}cripple{/sc} {sc}disable{/sc} mean to lose or cause to lose strength or vigor. {sc}weaken{/sc} may imply loss of physical strength, health, soundness, or stability or of quality, intensity, or effective power.

pt.t: a disease that {it}weakens{/it} the body's defenses

pt: {sc}enfeeble{/sc} implies a condition of marked weakness and helplessness.
{sc}debilitate{/sc} suggests a less marked or more temporary impairment of strength or vitality.
{sc}undermine{/sc} and {sc}sap{/sc} suggest a weakening by something working surreptitiously and insidiously.

pt.t: drugs had {it}sapped{/it} his ability to think

pt: {sc}cripple{/sc} implies causing a serious loss of functioning power through damaging or removing an essential part or element.
{sc}disable{/sc} suggests bringing about impairment or limitation in a physical or mental ability.

pt.t: {it}disabled{/it} by an injury sustained at work

shortdef: to deprive of the use of a limb and especially a leg
to deprive of capability for service or of strength, efficiency, or wholeness
